intro: Amomum monophyllum, commonly known as black cardamom, is a tropical evergreen plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, dark-colored seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–3 meters, with broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small white flowers. Its seeds, which are used in cooking and traditional medicine, have a strong, spicy aroma similar to cardamom. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its aromatic properties.
